snippet: Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, angrily cut short a key gathering of top security officials, accusing an unnamed participant of leaking details of the sensitive meeting to the media.
abstract: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu abruptly cancels a meeting of his security cabinet, accusing an unnamed participant of leaking details of the sensitive meeting to the media, and says that the security failure could undermine his efforts to project a unified front to the West about how to deal with Iran’s nuclear program.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, angrily cut short a key gathering of top security officials, accusing an unnamed participant of leaking details of the sensitive meeting to the media.

headline.seo: Netanyahu Cancels Security Meeting After Leak
headline.main: Leak Prompts Netanyahu to Cancel Security Cabinet Meeting on Iran Issue
headline.print_headline: Leak Prompts Netanyahu to Cancel Security Cabinet Meeting on Iran Issue
